STRATEGY_RULES.statement: Solve all problems using stepwise differentiation, integration, and algebraic analysis without heuristic optimization.
Explicitly analyze domain and split into cases when absolute value, piecewise functions, or domain restrictions appear.

PROCESS_RULES.statement: Differentiate functions to analyze increasing/decreasing behavior and locate critical points.
Use the second derivative to classify each critical point as local maximum, minimum, or inflection point.
At domain endpoints, evaluate the function directly to determine possible absolute extrema.
Perform definite integrals by computing the antiderivative and evaluating upper and lower limits.
For composite functions, differentiate using chain rule and integrate using substitution (u-substitution).
When functions contain absolute values, split cases based on inner expression sign before proceeding with differentiation or integration.
In motion problems, treat first derivative of position as velocity, and second derivative as acceleration.
Find total distance by integrating absolute value of velocity over the interval.
When working on symmetric intervals, apply symmetry properties of even or odd functions to simplify definite integrals where applicable.
During reasoning, maintain exact symbolic form unless numerical approximation is explicitly requested.

EDGE_CASE_RULES.statement: Detect and note points where the derivative does not exist, such as cusps, corners, or vertical tangents.
Explicitly verify all branches and domain conditions before merging cases.
When differentiating or integrating absolute value functions, handle sign of inner function before applying calculus procedures.
